intro: Arabis tianschanica, commonly known as the Tian Shan rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch to its natural habitat. Arabis tianschanica is often found in crevices and on slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
